column4: I just switched my 10 Mbit NIC out of the other machine and installed a 100 Mbit NIC. Link lights indicate hardware is working. lspci shows the hardware is present. However, it's not appearing as eth0. possibly I need to load a module? or need to configure something? but I don't know what. Any suggestions please.
prbly eth1 now, ; connected by dhcp ?
ifconfig says ?
then manually go by ifup, if eth0 doesn't work (old mac) then try eth1(and please put nick, or I loose messages)
gksudo gedit  /etc/network/interfaces
match to your desired ip : http://pastebin.com/afDdbcbz
configure Interfaces properly, if lspci see's card, unlikely a module problem
also lo is mentioned there, I hope
when done, sudo ifup -a  should do it
with an lo section above, fine : sudo service networking restart
sounds plausible
sudo service networking start
tried connecting in running service ?
start service as above, try to connect
ping router, f.e.  or use browser
can you ping your router ?
ah
hehe
so use it in interfaces and be done
arpwatcch ? idk, something around mac-ethX I assume
old mac i guess
yes, unless other setttings needed wouldn't suffer
good netting then :)
